name: Alistair Moffat
content: Alistair Moffat Alistair Moffat Access Methods Postal: Alistair Moffat School of Computing and Information Systems The University of Melbourne Victoria 3010, Australia E-mail: ammoffat / unimelb.edu.au (Note: as of October 2005 the old alistair / cs.mu.oz.au address was deprecated; and as of December 2011 the replacement alistair / csse.unimelb.edu.au was also phased out. Only the "at unimelb" address will now work.) Phone: n/a (my current workpoint does not have a telephone) Physical location: Level 2 Melbourne Connect Building (Building 290) The University of Melbourne Victoria 3010, Australia. Research interests Text and index compression Text indexing methods, index construction Information retrieval heuristics Current Research and List of Papers Books Programming, Problem Solving, and Abstraction with C, 2003, 2013 Compression and Coding Algorithms, 2002 Managing Gigabytes: Compressing and Indexing Documents and Images, 1994, 1999 Postgraduate students Tian Li (joint with Artem Polyvyanyy and Sander Leemans; current) Marjan Azimi (joint with Justin Zobel; current) Anandi Sethunga Mudiyanselage (joint with Artem Polyvyanyy; current) Reyhaneh Goli (joint with George Buchanan; current) Linh Huynh (completed an ME in 1994) Mario Selvestrel (completed an MEngSc in 1995) Andrew Turpin (completed a PhD in 1998) Tony Wirth (completed an MSc in 2000) Owen de Kretser (completed a PhD in 2000) Kusnadi (completed MCS in 2003) Mike Liddell (completed a PhD in 2003) Raymond Wan (completed a PhD in 2003, thesis record) Vo Ngoc Anh (completed an MSc in 1998, PhD in 2004) Nick Lester (joint with Justin Zobel, completed a PhD at RMIT in 2006, thesis) Yi Li (completed a MCS in 2007) J. Shane Culpepper (completed a PhD in 2007) William Webber (joint with Justin Zobel, completed an MEngSc in 2006, PhD in 2010, thesis) Sri Devi Ravana (completed a PhD in 2011 thesis record) Stefan Pohl (joint with Justin Zobel, completed a PhD in 2011, thesis) Yugo Kartono Isal (awarded a doctorate by the University of Indonesia, 2012) Rodrigo CÃ¡novas (joint with Andrew Turpin, completed a PhD in 2015, thesis) Ching Lih Lim (joint with Tony Wirth, completed an MPhil in 2015, thesis) Xiaolu Lu (joint with Shane Culpepper, completed a PhD at RMIT in 2018, thesis)) Ziying (Alicia) Yang (joint with Andrew Turpin, completed a PhD in 2019, thesis) Alfan Farizki Wicaksono (joint with Justin Zobel, completed a PhD in 2020, thesis) Unni Krishnan (joint with Justin Zobel, completed a PhD in 2021, thesis) Rodger Benham (joint with Shane Culpepper, at completed a PhD at RMIT in 2023) Louis Cheung (joint with Christine Rizkallah; completed a PhD in 2025, thesis) Hanan Alkhammash (joint with Artem Polyvyanyy; submitted PhD thesis in 2025) Out and about, getting the job done... William Webber, Stefan Pohl, Yuye Zhang, and Sri Devi Ravana, engrossed in SIGIR proceedings, September 2008. Anh Ngoc Vo, Laurence Park, Stefan Pohl, and Yuye Zhang in Singapore during SIGIR, July 2008. A photo album of activities at SIGIR 2007 Alistair, John Tait (Sunderland University), and Gary Marchionini (University of North Carolina), Joint PC Chairs of SIGIR 2005, at the banquet in Salvador, Brazil, August 2005. Justin Zobel (RMIT), Bruce Croft (UMass), and Dave Lewis (Consultant) in Salvador, Brazil, during SIGIR, August 2005. A photo album of activities at SWIRL 2004 Dave Hawking (CSIRO), Justin Zobel (RMIT), and Andrew Turpin (Curtin University) at Lanach Castle, Dunedin, prior to the ACSW'2004 Conference Dinner, January 2004. Ross Wilkinson (CSIRO), Justin Zobel (RMIT), Andrew Turpin (Curtin University), and Alistair, in the ICT Building at the University, November 2003 (picture by Ricardo Baeza-Yates). Gad Landau, Alberto Apostolico, and Alistair, in Fukuoka Japan, attending the 2002 International Symposium on Combinatorial Pattern Matching. Mike Ciavarella, Mike Liddell, and local Utah resident Art Pollard, at the 2002 IEEE Data Compression Conference. Alistair and Andrew Turpin, attending the 2002 Australasian Computer Science Conference. Alistair and Gonzalo Navarro (University of Chile) at the San Rafael Glacier, Chile, attending the 2001 SPIRE String Processing and Information Retrieval Conference. Raymond Wan, Alistair, and Anh Ngoc Vo in New Orleans, Louisiana, attending the 2001 SIGIR Information Retrieval Conference. Alistair, Mike Liddell, Yugo Isal, and Tony Wirth in Snowbird, Utah, attending the 2001 IEEE Data Compression Conference. Academic Activities I have been involved in the organisation of these activities: Australasian Computer Science Week, ACSW, February 1996 ACM-SIGIR Conference on Research and Development in Information Retrieval, SIGIR, August 1998 Strategic Workshop on Information Retrieval, SWIRL, December 2004 Australasian Document Computing Symposium, ADCS, December 2004 Fifty Years of Computing at the University of Melbourne, June 2006 Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval, SPIRE, November 2008 Strategic Workshop on Information Retrieval, SWIRL, February 2012 CIKM 2015 was in Melbourne in October 2015 WSDM 2019 was in Melbourne in February 2019 SIGIR 2026 will be in Melbourne in July 2026 (and has a announcement video to help us attract people here) Teaching In 2026 I will again be teaching into two subjects in the School: comp20005 Intro. to Numerical Computation in C (semester one) comp10002 Foundations of Algorithms (semester two) Alistair Moffat ammoffat / unimelb.edu.au November 28, 2025.
